item.title: Report E-2024080709
item.description:
Report E-2024080709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of UN1992 were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, shrink wrap, pallet, nearby freight, and cardboard boxes the product was contained in. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED DUE TO SPRING WATER LEAKER. BROUGHT BACK PACKAGES TO SERVICE CENTER FOR PROCESSING. DAMAGE INSPECTION ON AFFECTED BOX REVEALED A SUBBOX CONTAINING 6 UNDECLARED AEROSOLS. UPS UNDECLARED HAZMAT PROTOCOL INITIATED. REWRAP; NO LEAK.

item.title: Report X-2024081589
item.description:
Report X-2024081589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/19/2024 at approximately 2100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3667328 at the station in Portland, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of a polystyrene package, containing various food items packed on wet ice, along with two plastic containers of "Multi-Clor". The outer packaging appeared to colapse under the weight, exposing the shipment's contents. An online safety data sheet, retrieved by Dangerous Goods Administration, classified "Multi-Clor" as UN 1791 Hypochlorite solution. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it was not completed with the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024081495
item.description:
Report X-2024081495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ON THE IRREGULAR BELT. RESPONDER NOTICED THE OUTER WALL OF BOX INDICATED IT WAS EITHER LEAKING FROM WITHIN OR LEAKED ON BY AN OUTSIDE SOURCE. RESPONDER HAD PPE ON AND BROUGHT THE BOX TO THE PSC. UPON OPENING THE BOX, IT WAS DETERMINED THE "WICKED FOAM N'FRESH" WAS THE SOURCE. DAMAGE INSPECTION; NON HAZARDOUS LEAKER; NO LEAK TO NAIL PRODUCTS. THE (3) NAIL PRODUCTS ARE ACETONE FREE BUT CONTAIN HIGHLY FLAMMABLE ISOBUTYL NITRATE. BOTTLES LABELED FLAMMABLE / HIGHLY FLAMMABLE. REQUESTED SAFETY DATA SHEETS SEVERAL TIMES BUT DID NOT RECEIVE THEM FROM THE SHIPPER.
